cs.SI, cs.SOC, cs.LG, cs.DS, cs.IT. 

The paper deals with social learning, which is a topic that falls under the intersection of computer science and social sciences. The paper also discusses the influence of certain agents on the beliefs of others, which is a topic that falls under social networks and graph theory. Therefore, the most likely sub-categories are cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) and cs.SOC (Computational Social Science). The paper also uses mathematical expressions to characterize the influence of agents, which suggests that it may belong to the sub-categories of cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms). Finally, the paper discusses the flow of information, which is a topic that falls under cs.IT (Information Theory).
